head.title: To Heal the Poor of the World

hedline.hl1: To Heal the Poor of the World

block.p: Re ''Drug Makers and 3rd World: Study in Neglect'' (front page, May 21): It may be worthwhile for pharmaceutical companies to note that all human beings are prone to the same infectious diseases, given the right environment for the causative agent to spread and multiply. With a world that is smaller by the day through air travel, it is not inconceivable that we would see cases of malaria or sleeping sickness in any American or European city.

Re ''Drug Makers and 3rd World: Study in Neglect'' (front page, May 21): It may be worthwhile for pharmaceutical companies to note that all human beings are prone to the same infectious diseases, given the right environment for the causative agent to spread and multiply. With a world that is smaller by the day through air travel, it is not inconceivable that we would see cases of malaria or sleeping sickness in any American or European city.
Less than a year ago, very few people could have imagined that West Nile encephalitis would be a problem in Manhattan, Queens or Long Island.
FIKRY B. SALIB, M.D. Stamford, Conn., May 21, 2000
